title: 107_s2896
content: The Act may be cited as the "National AMBER Alert Network Act of 2002" and it focuses on the national coordination of AMBER Alert communications network. The "National AMBER Alert Network Act of 2002" designates an officer within the Department of Justice as the national coordinator of the AMBER Alert communications network for abducted children. The Coordinator's duties include closing network gaps, promoting local AMBER plans, ensuring regional coordination, and serving as the nationwide contact for network development. The Coordinator of the AMBER Alert communications network is responsible for developing the network and coordinating alerts on abducted children regionally. They must consult with the FBI, cooperate with the Department of Transportation and FCC, and work with the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children and other relevant organizations. Minimum standards for issuing and sharing alerts through the AMBER Alert Communications Network are outlined in Section 3. The AMBER Alert Coordinator of the Department of Justice will establish voluntary minimum standards for issuing and disseminating alerts through the AMBER Alert communications network. The dissemination of alerts will be limited to geographic areas most likely to aid in the recovery of the abducted child. The Coordinator must not interfere with the current voluntary system. The Coordinator will cooperate with relevant authorities and organizations to establish minimum standards for the AMBER Alert communications network. Grant program established for notification and communications systems along highways to aid in the recovery of abducted children. The Secretary of Transportation will provide grants to States for developing notification systems along highways to aid in recovering abducted children. Activities may include electronic message boards and dissemination of alerts. Federal funding may cover up to 50% of the costs. The Secretary will distribute grants equitably across the US regions for highway notification systems to aid in child recovery. The Secretary will set grant requirements and authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2003. "Grant program established for support of Amber Alert communications plans." The Attorney General will provide grants to States for AMBER Alert communications plans. Activities may include education, training, law enforcement programs, and equipment. The Federal share of funding may not exceed 50 percent. The Attorney General will distribute grants under the program on an equitable basis throughout the US regions. The grants will have requirements set by the Attorney General, including application requirements. Appropriations are authorized for the Department of Justice for fiscal year 2003 to carry out this section. The Senate passed the legislation on September 10, 2002, with Jeri Thomson as the Secretary.
